macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: TSX Composite Surges 1.7% to 33,023 on Metals and Tech Rally
items.summary: The S&P/TSX Composite Index rose 552 points or 1.7% to 33,023, extending two-day gains to 3.2%, driven by surging metals prices and tech recovery; top performers included IAMGOLD, Orla Mining, and Alamos Gold, each up at least 8%.[1]

items.title: Vizsla Silver Plunges 12% After Employee Deaths in Mexico
items.summary: Vizsla Silver shares dropped over 12% following confirmation that several employees taken from its Mexico project site were found deceased, raising concerns over security and operations.[1]

items.title: Dow Hits Intraday Record High at 50,309 Amid Mixed Earnings
items.summary: The Dow rose 0.40% to a new intraday high of 50,309, while S&P 500 and Nasdaq were flat to slightly down; markets reacted to unchanged December retail sales and mixed corporate earnings.[2]

items.title: Spotify Soars 15.5% on Strong Earnings; S&P Global Drops 7%
items.summary: Spotify Technology jumped 15.5% after strong earnings, joined by DataDog in double-digit gains; S&P Global fell 7% on weak guidance, Coca-Cola dipped 2% on in-line forecast, and Xylem declined 9%.[2]

items.title: Air Canada Shares Slip 4.5% on Cuba Service Suspension
items.summary: Air Canada stock fell 4.5% after announcing suspension of all flights to Cuba due to an ongoing aviation fuel shortage.[1]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Drops Nearly $2,000 Amid Market Slide
items.summary: Bitcoin fell 3% or $1,916 to $66,812 on Wednesday ahead of key U.S. payrolls data and CPI inflation report, marking continued consolidation. Ethereum also slumped, while Coinbase and MicroStrategy shares dropped over 3% in premarket.

items.title: Crypto Winter Continues as Bitcoin Extends Losing Streak
items.summary: Bitcoin slid to around $69,470 after a slow start to the week, adding to its longest losing streak since 2018. Discussion highlights U.S. government efforts to set rules for crypto, stablecoins, and digital assets.

items.title: Bitcoin's Sharp Decline Confirms Bearish Phase
items.summary: Bitcoin's break below the prior cycle high under $69k signals a confirmed bearish market transition, raising questions about the durability of any rebound.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Microchip Extends Edge AI Solutions for Production-Ready Applications
items.summary: Microchip Technology launched full-stack edge AI solutions using its MCUs, MPUs, and FPGAs to enable real-time inferencing in industrial, automotive, and IoT applications. The offerings include the VectorBlox Accelerator SDK 2.0, aligning with top industry trends for low-latency, privacy-enhanced AI.

items.title: TELUS Digital Research Reveals LLM Accuracy Issues Under Challenge
items.summary: A new TELUS Digital poll and research paper evaluated GPT-5.2, Gemini 3 Pro, Claude Sonnet 4.5, and Llama-4, finding that challenging prompts rarely improve accuracy and can reduce it. The Certainty Robustness Benchmark highlights instability in leading models when questioned.

items.title: Josh Bersin Company: AI Disrupting $400B Corporate Training Market
items.summary: New research from The Josh Bersin Company shows AI enabling 'dynamic enablement' in learning, outperforming traditional methods with AI-first teams 2x more innovative. The Definitive Guide to Corporate Learning details findings from 800 organizations and 50+ case studies.

items.title: ApplyBoard Wins Best Paper Award for AI Safety Breakthrough at IEEE Conference
items.summary: ApplyBoard's research team received the Best Paper Award at an IEEE international conference for advancements in AI safety. The breakthrough addresses critical challenges in ensuring reliable AI systems.

items.title: Key AI Executives Depart from Anthropic, xAI, and Thinking Machines Lab
items.summary: Anthropic's safeguards research lead Mrinank Sharma resigned after three years; xAI saw a departure amid Musk's comments on acceleration; Thinking Machines Lab lost three co-founders despite $1B funding, with some returning to OpenAI.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Blueprint Gaming Secures Game of Thrones Slot Game Licensing Deal
items.summary: Blueprint Gaming announced a major licensing agreement with Warner Bros. Discovery to develop online slot games based on Game of Thrones and House of the Dragon, with the first title launching in March featuring iconic characters and mechanics.

items.title: The9 Launches AI-Powered Short Drama and Interactive Movie Game Based on TVB IP
items.summary: The9 partnered with Chengdu Lumosi to develop AI-enhanced short dramas and interactive movie games using the licensed TVB classic IP The Greed of Man, focusing on AI-driven storytelling and cinematic narratives.

items.title: Valve Delays Steam Machine, Steam Deck Frame, and Controller Amid RAM Crisis
items.summary: Valve has delayed shipping and pricing announcements for Steam Machine, Steam Frame, and Steam Controller due to ongoing RAM shortages impacting hardware pricing.

items.title: Intel CEO Confirms Entry into Discrete GPU Market
items.summary: Intel's CEO announced the company will produce discrete GPUs, hiring a lead executive, amid GPU shortages driven by AI demand.

items.title: PS Plus Extra and Premium February 2026 Games Leak Incoming
items.summary: Leaks suggest Sony will soon reveal PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium free games for February 2026, with details teased by insider Billbil-kun.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Workday CEO Carl Eschenbach Steps Down Amid Market Turmoil
items.summary: Workday CEO Carl Eschenbach announced his departure, to be replaced by cofounder Aneel Bhusri, following market volatility that impacted SaaS stocks and wiped $2 trillion off market value last week.

items.title: White House Considers Voluntary Data Center Restrictions to Protect Power Grids
items.summary: The Trump administration is finalizing a voluntary agreement with tech companies to limit data center impacts on retail power bills, water resources, and grid reliability amid infrastructure complaints.

items.title: Microsoft Explores Superconducting Power Lines for Energy-Efficient Data Centers
items.summary: Microsoft is investigating advanced superconducting power lines to enhance data center efficiency and accelerate its major U.S. expansion efforts.

items.title: UBS Downgrades Tech Stock Forecast Due to Big Tech Capex Pressures
items.summary: UBS analysts have turned bearish on technology stocks, citing heavy capital expenditure plans by major tech companies as a key concern amid broader market advances.
